icontrol.drivers.instruments

Class NewInstrument

  • java.lang.Object
    • icontrol.drivers.Device
      • icontrol.drivers.instruments.NewInstrument

  • @iC_Annotation(CommPorts=GPIB,
               InstrumentClassName="New Instrument")
public class NewInstrument
extends Device
    This is the default template for new Instruments. The documentation on how to implement new Instruments can be accessed from the main page of the javadoc. The online version of the javadoc can be found at http://icontrol.java.net.

    Please document your class carefully: NewInstrument ZYX Hypothetical Weather Controller "driver" class.

    All device commands that the NewInstrument understands are implemented here.

    Instrument Commands:

    • DemoCommand(float, String, boolean)
    • DisplayPreviousResult()
    • ReferenceImplementation(float, boolean, String)
    • setTemp(float)
    Version:
    0.4
    Author:
    KPP (Kurt Pernstich: pernstich@alumni.ethz.ch)

    • Method Detail

      • DemoCommand

        @AutoGUIAnnotation(DescriptionForUser="<html>This is an exemplary implementation of a new method.<br>For long ToolTip texts it is helpful to use html and insert<br>line breaks<br>. For shorter texts one can skip the html tags. </html>",
                   ParameterNames={"A float value","A string","Syntax Check flag"},
                   DefaultValues={"1.1","Love All, Serve All","true"},
                   ToolTips={"for demonstration only","","Use this to decide if SyntaxCheck fails or succeeds."})
 @iC_Annotation(MethodChecksSyntax=true)
public void DemoCommand(float Param1,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           java.lang.String Param2,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           boolean Param3)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    throws javax.script.ScriptException,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           java.io.IOException,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           java.util.zip.DataFormatException
        This is an demo implementation of a new device command to help understanding how to write new Instrument Commands. Use the ReferenceImplementation to implement new Instrument Commands.

        This method shows a message to the user when in SyntaxCheck mode and also when the 'real' action is performed.

        This method implements the Syntax-Check mode.

        Parameters:
        Param1 - is shown to the user.
        Param2 - is shown to the user.
        Param3 - when true, the SyntaxCheck will succeed, otherwise it will fail.
        Throws:
        javax.script.ScriptException - when conversion of the Instrument's answer to a float fails.
        java.io.IOException - re-thrown from QueryInstrument
        java.util.zip.DataFormatException - when the Syntax Check failed.

      • ReferenceImplementation

        @AutoGUIAnnotation(DescriptionForUser="<html>A reference implementation of<br>a Instrument Command.</html>",
                   ParameterNames={"Value 1","Value 2","Value 3"},
                   DefaultValues={"1.1","true","\"Command-Line in double quotes\""},
                   ToolTips={"TT1","TT2","The command to execute"})
 @iC_Annotation(MethodChecksSyntax=true)
public void ReferenceImplementation(float Param1,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      boolean Param2,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      java.lang.String CommandLine)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               throws javax.script.ScriptException,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      java.io.IOException,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      java.util.zip.DataFormatException
        This is a reference implementation of a typical Instrument command. Use this as a template for your new methods that implement a script command.

        This method performs a Syntax-Check.

        Parameters:
        Param1 - is a placeholder.
        Param2 - is a placeholder.
        CommandLine - is interpreted as a Command Line which is executed when not in SyntaxCheck-Mode and the returned value is interpreted as a float value.
        Throws:
        javax.script.ScriptException - when conversion of the Instrument's answer to a float fails during processing the CommandLine.
        java.io.IOException - re-thrown from QueryInstrument
        java.util.zip.DataFormatException - when the Syntax Check failed.

      • DisplayPreviousResult

        @AutoGUIAnnotation(DescriptionForUser="<html>Displays the result of the previous Script command<br>if it is of ype float.</html>",
                   ParameterNames={},
                   DefaultValues={},
                   ToolTips={})
public void DisplayPreviousResult()
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         throws javax.script.ScriptException
        This method demonstrates the use of the result of the succeeding script command. If the result is of type float, it is displayed as Status Text in the GUI.
        Throws:
        javax.script.ScriptException - when the data type of the return value of the previous script command was different from float.

      • setTemp

        @AutoGUIAnnotation(DescriptionForUser="Sets the SetPoint temperature.",
                   ParameterNames="Temperature [K]",
                   DefaultValues="295",
                   ToolTips="Define tool-tips here")
 @iC_Annotation(MethodChecksSyntax=true)
public void setTemp(float SetPoint)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                throws java.io.IOException,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       java.util.zip.DataFormatException
        Reference implementation of a minimal method body. This is the example listed in the publication (http://dx.doi.org/10.6028/jres.117.010)
        Parameters:
        SetPoint - The new temperature
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - re-thrown from SendToInstrument or QueryInstrument.
        java.util.zip.DataFormatException - when the Syntax Check failed.
